snippet: American officials appeared to be caught off guard by the announcement and suggested that Iran had not met all the conditions for attending the conference to end the war in Syria.
abstract: United States appears to be caught off guard by announcement from United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon that he had invited Iran to a peace conference to end the war in Syria; news draws strong objections from American officials, who suggest that Iran has not met all the conditions for attending and that the invitation might need to be withdrawn.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from New York, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: American officials appeared to be caught off guard by the announcement and suggested that Iran had not met all the conditions for attending the conference to end the war in Syria.

headline.main: U.N. Invites Iran to Syria Talks, Raising Objections From the U.S.
headline.print_headline: U.N. Invites Iran to Syria Talks, Raising Objections From the U.S.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
